frontmatter.title: Stacks
frontmatter.description: Stacks are homogenous data structures (they can only store elements of the same kind) like arrays, but they're different from normal arrays such that you can only add or remove items from the top of the stack. This nature is also called, Last in, First out (LIFO)

frontmatter.title: Classes and Objects
frontmatter.description: Classes serve as templates to objects in your program. Classes and objects are the first concepts you need to understand for Object Oriented Programming (OOP). Variables inside classes are called attributes, while functions inside classes are called methods.

frontmatter.title: Structs
frontmatter.description: Structs or structures in c++ are collections of related data items, possibly of different types (heterogenous).

frontmatter.title: Python For Loops
frontmatter.description: Reading user input is an important part of a program. To collect user input from the terminal in Python, we use the input() method. To store user input to a variable, use 'variable = input()'
